page.title: 10Sancta Maria Abbey, Nunraw
page.content: This is a Cistercian Monastery of some 30 Scottish, English and Irish monks. Rising at 3.15am and retiring at 8pm they follow the Benedictine rule, their day divided between prayer, community mass, divine office, instruction, study & work. To earn their living, they rear almost 700 beef cattle on their 1200 acres, growing barley to feed them. Nunraw's influence on inter church relations is acknowleded nationally. But, as contemplative monks, they insist that their sole contribution is prayer. Fr. Abbot is an ex-officio member of the village society and takes a keen interest in village activities. Nunraw Chapel is public, the cloisters opened for processions on major feasts Countless people visit Nunraw for spiritual help and all are welcomed warmly.
